Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-S1 (DRS-S1; Dermaseptin I; DS I; Dermaseptin S1, DRS S1, natural AMPs; UCLL1a; frog, amphibians, animals; ZZS; ZZHa_t; ZZP)
Sequence Information.Source: Sauvage's leaf frog,Phyllomedusa sauvagii, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against A. caviae IP67-16T (MIC 0.5 uM), E. coli IP76-24 (MIC 1 uM), E. faecalis IP103214, S. aureus IP76-25 (MIC 5 uM), N. brasiliensis IP118079 (MIC 35 uM), S. cerevisiae IP118079 (MIC 5 uM), C. albicans IP884-65, IP886-65 (MIC 10 uM), C. neoformans IP960-67 and IP962-67  (MIC 0.5-1 uM), M. canis IP1194 (MIC 15 uM), T. rubrum IP2043-92 (MIC 35 uM), T. metagrophytes IP877-71 (MIC 20 uM), A. simii IP1063-74, mutant (MIC 30 uM), A. simii J43 (MIC 15 uM), A. niger IP218-53 and A. fumigatus IP1025-70 (MIC 30 uM).  Active against S. aureus and E. coli (MIC 12 uM). The peptide is active against L. major (Perez-Cordero JJ et al. 2011 Peptides 32 (4), 683-90).Also showed spermicidal activity.This peptide could inhibit HIV infection at a concentration that is also toxic to T cells (J Virol 2005; 79:11598-11606). Also inhibit FV3 (IC50 =12 uM), CCV (IC50 3 uM), HSV-1 (32 uM).SAR: A segment corresponding to residue 1-18 was found to have a comparable activity to the parent peptide (JBC 1994; 269: 1934-39).Structure:  helical in TFE. Ref updated 7/2016; Jan2020; 5/2020; 7/2020
Literature Information.Author: Mor A, Nguyen VH, Delfour A, Migliore-Samour D, Nicolas P.1991
Literature Information.Title: Isolation, amino acid sequence, and synthesis of dermaseptin, a novel antimicrobial peptide of amphibian skin
